description.p: A minimalist, privacy-focused desktop application for offline speech-to-text. Converts voice input directly into any active window (editors, browsers, IDEs, AI assistants) using the Whisper model locally for speech recognition.
ðŸ“‹ For system tray integration on GNOME (install AppIndicator extension) and automatic typing on Wayland (setup ydotool), see Desktop Environment Support Guide.

ul.li: Cross-platform support for X11 and Wayland
Desktop Environment Support: Native integration with GNOME, KDE, and other Linux DEs
Privacy-first: desktop, no data sent to external servers
Support: multi-language, global hotkeys, automatic typing & clipboard, system tray integration, visual notifications, WebSocket API (optional)

ul.li: Updated Go dependencies to latest compatible versions (Go 1.24.1)
Bump Whisper.cpp to v1.8.2 for improved performance and stability
Simplified Docker workflow with Docker-first approach
Clear Docker-based make targets for reproducible AppImage builds
Single binary supports both daemon mode (system tray) and CLI mode (scripting)
CLI commands for tiling window managers (i3, sway, bspwm)
IPC communication via Unix socket for low-latency operations
JSON output for automation and scripts
High-resolution 500x500 tray icon for HiDPI screens
